data.title: Disgusting!
data.text: We have loved this place for years and whatever they have going on now needs to go!  We got take out and we live within 5 miles, when we got it home it was cold, a screwed up order, brown  guacamole and over heat corn tortillas that you couldn't pull apart. We called and complained and then took it back for a full refund....of course they kept the tip we left!  Will not be back!

data.title: BEST MEXICAN FOOD EVER!!
data.text: I just LOVE this place!!  Food is AWESOME!!  Fast and good!  Staff is friendly and helpful!  GREAT Customer Service!!

data.title: Authentic atmosphere and great food
data.text: Nice atmosphere and the food was very good. Nice variety of choices and service was very good and pleasant.

data.title: wife and myself out for a Sunday dinner
data.text: nice clean and friendly the food was good and the price is ok  the waiter was very good we will be back  in a few weeks

data.title: Excellent Mexican Restaurant
data.text: My wife & I have been to El Tanampa a couple times & think the food is the best in Meridian. The chips, salsa & beans that start the meal are wonderful and the waiter we had (Eddie) was a pleasure. We both enjoyed our meals and especially the hand made corn tortillas. We have tried 6 other Mexican restaurants but El Tanampa in Meridian is the best.

data.title: Lunch
data.text: We come here on a regular basis and the food is good.... especially the lunch menu. In the evening you can get mariachi music from the old guy...be polite, tip him, and enjoy. Would be nice to be recognized as a regular since we are in here all the time.

data.title: Excellent Food And Service
data.text:
Great dinner. My wife loved her enchiladas verde, and I had the best mole chicken I have had in a restaurant in years. 

The Modelo was cold and the service was excellent.

What more do you want in a Mexican restaurant?

data.title: Best Guacamole in Meridian!
data.text:
I have been to El Tenampa at least a dozen time this past year.  
They do a table side guacamole using all fresh ingredients.
It is the real deal and delish!  Served with very good salsa, chips, and a bean dip.
Most of the time my entrées have been great.  It is not your foo foo, gourmet type of mexican food....just your basic, good to satisfy your craving.
I like the Chile Colorado and my husband likes the Carne Asada.  
The margaritas are so, so..taste like they are made from a mix but acceptable. Like I said not a gourmet place but if you are looking for good mexican food at good price give it a try!

data.title: Most Authentic
data.text: The menu is a bit overwhelming. There is a lot to choose from and you wonder how they can offer so many items and still keep things fresh. Mole chicken enchiladas were good, sauce was sweet and tortillas soft. Siete Mares soup was fresh, not frozen and flavor was good. I've been to other restaurants in the area where this same soup was full of frozen veggies but this place had fresh carrots, celery, tomatoes and seafood also tasted pretty fresh. We had table side guacamole-very good and not too expensive. The waitress was very attentive and we did not have to ask her for much because she had it all covered. The only negative about this restaurant was the smoke smell. I'm not sure if the smell was coming from somewhere else in the building but it was unpleasant while eating. Despite the smoke smell, I will definitely be back and would recommend this place to others.

data.title: Won't go back to this location
data.text: We used to love this place.  Came back today after probably 5 years. The waitress was rude, the cook got my order wrong. The buffet was dry and so not worth the money. Then in the end they wouldn't honor a coupon we had that said receive a free entree when you buy one and instead only gave is 5.00 off. So disappointed to have spent the money here.

data.title: Very good food and friendly staff
data.text: We decided to try a few of the Mexican restaurants in the area that we had heard good things about overall.  This one was our favorite.  The food was very good-authentic and full of flavor.  We tried the chicken mole enchiladas and the chicken enchiladas suizas.  Both were delicious, with very flavorful chicken and rich sauces.  We will definitely go back again.

data.title: El Tenampa
data.text: Quick service, tasty margarita's, and flavorful Mexican food. We love the people there, and their food.

data.title: There are too many really good Mexican restaurants to waste your time with this one.
data.text: If you are driving right by this place, or perhaps sitting in the parking lot reading this review, then go on inside. They are nice folks (my experience) and the atmosphere is standard fare for this venue. I didn't get sick every time I ate there, but it happened. If you're looking for a very good Mexican restaurant, and don't mind driving a bit, check out any number of other restaurants in the area.

data.title: Home made, not a chain, great food
data.text: First time we have reviewed El Tenampa, but have eaten there many times in the past.  We love the true flavors of "real" mexican food, not the stuff churned out by the chanin restaurants.  My wife loves the combos and they are good, but I go for the lesser known dishes full of flavor.  Tonight it was the Steak City, cuts of skirt steak grilled to tender with a spicy sauce and cheese mushrooms and avocado on top.  Fantastic flavors a job well done.

data.title: Disappointed!!!
data.text: Sorry we can't make positive comments on this one.   We have eaten at many, many Mexican Restaurants & this the first time we had Cold food when it should have been hot.  Actually the Fahita Burrito my husband had was partly frozen when served first time, after supposedly having it heated up, it was still on the cool side...This is hot food!!!  Don't think we will go back, even though Atmosphere was nice, service OK, by other waiter other than ours.  Ours didn't make extra effort to make sure food was at correct Temp.....Am really disappointed.

data.title: Night Out
data.text:
Really like this place.  They are always very friendly and attentive.  The food is always great.  Had a Cadillac Margatria and it was awesome, came with another "Side Shot" of tequila.  I had the Pork Carnitas for dinner and was stuffed when I got all done.  Probably shouldn't have finished it, the last one put me over the edge.  My wife enjoyed her meal as well.  They no longer give the Sopas (sp?) when you pay your bill :-(.  

They do have a buffet on Saturday's from 10:30 to 3pm which I didn't know.  They make their tortillas fresh.

data.title: My Favorite Mexican Food in Meridian
data.text:
At El Tenampa the food, atmosphere, and service are authentic. I usually go to lunch here at least once a month with either my husband or coworkers. The service is fast & friendly. You can easily get in and out within a one-hour lunch hour. Prices are reasonable. Food is good with lots of choices. My favorite part is the fresh warm tortilla chips served with bean dip and salsas.
The place is not fancy but is comfortable. I love seeing the same manager & wait staff every time.

data.title: What a surprise
data.text: Wow!  This is a great little place.  I was in Meridian on business and had lunch.  The food was delicious!!!  This is some of the best mexican food I have had in a long time.  Great flavor and spice.  The bean dip they give you with your chips was really good.  Generally it is on the bland side, but not at El Tenampa.  I had the chicken enchilada and shredded beef taco.  Yum!  The taco was fabulous, lots of flavor.  I would recommend this restaurant if you are anywhere in the area and are having a craving for Mexican fare.  I would definetly return when visiting Boise.  I look forward to doing so during dinner so that I can try a margarita!!

data.title: Friendly place
data.text: The food is OK but the service has always been good.
